We know of it, but info owned by others
Intelligence on Transaction Status: Engie Energia to retire Tocopilla coal plant (250 MW) through IDB loan package of USD 125 million (incl. USD 15 million of blended finance by Clean Technology Fund (CTF)). Lenders will pay Engie a floor price of USD 3/tCO2e abated through early retirement, by decreasing financing cost of CTF loan tranche. All proceeds were used for the construction of 151 MW of the Calama wind farm.
Planned post-retirement status: Conversion to a 116MW battery energy storage system

Information Status: We know of it, but info owned by others
Parent: Marubeni Corp [32.5%]; Korea Electric Power Corp [27.5%]; PT Indika Energy Tbk [20.0%]; Samchully Co Ltd
Intelligence on Transaction Status: Refinancing through ADB's Energy Transition Mechanism (ETM) facility of USD 250-300 million on the condition that Unit 1 retires earlier (target 2035). The ETM facility proceeds will be used for refinancing the existing debt, and a one off special dividend distribution to sponsors to cover foregone cash flow due to PPA tenure shortening and ETM transaction costs. Allegedly, the ETM transaction deal has stalled

We know of it, but info owned by others
Owner: Empresa Generadora de Electricidad Itabo SA [100%]
Parent: Grupo Linda [50.0%]; Fondo Patrimonial de las Empresas Reformadas [50.0%]; unknown [0.0%]
Intelligence on Transaction Status:
Concessional funding under the CIF ACT 75.5 million USD from IDB and IFC, along with private sector co-financing of 22.2 million USD to retire Itabo power station unit 1+2 early. 

It is planned to have 171 million USD of co-financing from IDB invest and IFC, as well as 440 million USD of co-financing to develop renewable energy replacement projects for Itabo power station 1+2, and Barahona coal.
Lender(s)/ Funder(s) involved: IDB Invest, IFC, Climate Investment Fund (CIF)
Planned post-retirement status: Conversion to renewable energy projects, to include solar, wind and BESS at a system level
